thread.title: Manchester United midfielder Juan Mata admits Europa League is now Red Devils' priority
thread.title_full: Manchester United midfielder Juan Mata admits Europa League is now Red Devils' priority

author: David McDonnell
title: Manchester United midfielder Juan Mata admits Europa League is now Red Devils' priority
text:
Sport Manchester United midfielder Juan Mata admits Europa League is now Red Devils' priority United face a battle to qualify for the Champions League by finishing in the top four with the Europa League offering a realistic route to the top table of European football Share Mata concedes the Europa League is now United's priority (Photo: John Peters) Share Get     
Juan Mata has admitted the Europa League has become Manchester United’s priority this season. 
United face Anderlecht in the quarter final, and with Jose Mourinho’s side six points off fourth spot and a run-in that includes trips to Manchester City, Tottenham and Arsenal, securing a Champions League place through the Premier League is looking slim. 
That is why the Europa League - which offers a Champions League place to the winners - is looking like being United’s best route to get back into Europe’s elite club competition. 
Mata, who scored the winner against Rostov that booked United’s place in the last eight, said: “It became a while ago very important for us. Mata has enjoyed an impressive campaign for United (Photo: Man Utd via Getty Images) The Spaniard has established himself as a key part of Jose Mourinho's side (Photo: Getty Images) 
“I still think we have the chance to get to the Champions League through the Premier League. 
“I still think we can win a lot of games and get into the third or fourth positions. But it’s another chance for us and we will take it very seriously. 
“It’s very important – it could be one more trophy and it means we play Champions League.” 
United travel to Middlesbrough tomorrow and Mata admitted it is vital Mourinho’s side take three points there, to stay within a realistic distance of the top-four before the international break. 
“It’s very important, especially after the draw against Bournemouth at Old Trafford,” said Mata. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
